title: [SciPy]: Parser Error: Segfault

labels.name: SciPy
labels.description: issues related to enable LFortran to compile the entire FORTRAN codebase in SciPy

body:
*Original issue*: https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/issues/757

```
% lfortran --show-ast scipy/linalg/src/id_dist/src/idz_svd.f --fixed-form
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/thebigbool/repos2/lfortran/src/bin/lfortran.cpp", line 1635
    return emit_ast(arg_file, compiler_options);
  File "/Users/thebigbool/repos2/lfortran/src/bin/lfortran.cpp", line 420
    LFortran::Result<std::string> r = fe.get_ast(input, lm, diagnostics);
  File "/Users/thebigbool/repos2/lfortran/src/lfortran/fortran_evaluator.cpp", line 161
    Result<AST::TranslationUnit_t*> ast = get_ast2(code, lm,
  File "/Users/thebigbool/repos2/lfortran/src/lfortran/fortran_evaluator.cpp", line 189
    Result<AST::TranslationUnit_t*> res = parse(al, *code, diagnostics, compiler_options.fixed_form);
  File "/Users/thebigbool/repos2/lfortran/src/lfortran/parser/parser.cpp", line 21
    p.parse(s);
  File "/Users/thebigbool/repos2/lfortran/src/lfortran/parser/parser.cpp", line 59
    if (yyparse(*this) == 0) {
  File "parser.tab.cc", line 19167
  File "parser.tab.cc", line 18856
  File "parser.yy", line 47
  File "/Users/thebigbool/repos2/lfortran/src/lfortran/parser/parser.cpp", line 658
    token = f_tokenizer.tokens[invalid_token];
  Binary file "/usr/lib/system/libsystem_platform.dylib", local address: 0x7fff20353d7c
Segfault: Signal SIGSEGV (segmentation fault) received
```

The minimal example to reproduce the error (The single line below is enough):
```
c       this file contains the following user-callable routines:
```
